channel.title: Fromage & Programming
channel.description: A summary of personnal courses/projects providing cheat sheet to help people starting to program in general.

item.title: Pokemon RTS
item.description:
Description A project I coded a while ago allowing you to compile a RTS ( ;) ) version of pokemon. it should arrive pretty soon! Just need to clean and upload it..

item.title: Network for Mouse Genetics
item.description: In collaboration with Raphael Reis, Gianni Giusto and Lucas ZweiliYou can access the full data story here Introduction Wikipedia describes the phenotype as the composite of the organism’s observable characteristics or traits. (…) An organism’s phenotype results from two basic factors: the expression of an organism’s genetic code, or its...

item.title: Visual Morse Code Decoder
item.description:
The project aims at developing a program/application which would read and translate morse codes like in the following image into plain words in real time, using CNN analyzing the image flow and keeping tracks of the stacked information.
— —

item.title: Higg Boson Competition
item.description: In collaboration with Gianni Giusto and Maxime EparsYou can access the github repo Introduction As part of the CS-433 master course of Machine Learning, an AI crowd competition took was organized for the students: the goal consisted in developing ourself the methods used such as KFold cross-validation, stochastic gradient descent,...

item.title: C++ Multithreaded Coencapsulation
item.description: Lab. of Systems Biology and Genetics (EPFL) - Introduction The goal of the project consisted in coencapsulation of micro-beads of RNA primers with cells into a single drop of lysis buffer using microships: both the cells and the beads would flow through channels A and B respectively. Microship used for coencapsulation: A. Cell channel B. Bead channel C....

item.title: Data Awareness Dunnhumby dataset
item.description: In collaboration with Raphael Reis, Daniel Pechao and Jérôme LüscherYou can access the full data story here Introduction We proposed an in-depth analysis of the complete-journey dunnhumby dataset: a file gathering information about consumer behaviors and demographic information for the dunnhumby supermarket chain. Implementation Since more than 90% of our...

item.title: A ML approach to determine chemical shifts in NMR
item.description: Lab. of Computational Science and Modeling (EPFL) - In collaboration with Gianni Giusto and Maxime Epars You can access the full report here Introduction Nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectroscopy is a method used to determine the chemical structure of a molecule based on the principle of the resonance frequency: any nuclear spin in a given structure depends on...

item.title: Machine Learning Competition ETH
item.description: In collaboration with Marijn Van der MeerYou can access the github repo Introduction As part of the Bachelor Machine Learning course at ETH, we participated in a competition using the various techniques seen during the course. This competition consisted of 2 training datasets both having 139 features: a labelled one...

item.title: List of Courses
item.description: This section aims at presenting a non-exhaustive list of the Data Science-related courses that I followed untill and including now during my cursus at EPFL and ETH. Current Courses Spring 2020 Deep Learning EE-559 Prof. François Fleuret: Empirical risk minimization, Multi-layer perceptron,Autograd, CNN, Dropout, Deep models for Computer Vision, Auto-encoders,...

item.title: Brie à l'ail des ours
item.description: Fromage présentant une odeur crémante, arrière d’ail des ours, dominance ail des ours, très frais tend vers l’amertume sans pour autant l’atteindre vraiment évoque l’attaqeu de la truffe mais n’explose pas au nez fondant, similaire au beurre croûte très fine, imperceptible a la mastication un peu d’étable à l’odeur ,...

item.title: Spark Cheat Sheet
item.description:
This is a Cheat sheet aiming at helping SPARK beginner users, as the error messages for this library can be (quite) frustrating when it comes to debug the code. --- ---
